title.native: 劇場版 少女☆歌劇 レヴュースタァライト

description:
The stage emulates life and compresses it, setting free skills learned over lifetimes in brief but dazzling displays for the amusement and judgment of others. For the performers, it is the ultimate risk, and some will rise while others must fall. Nowhere is this truer than at the Seisho Music Academy, where music, dance and real weapons all come into play in the creation of the next great Star. Karen and Hikari’s destinies have been linked since a childhood promise, but their journeys here have taken very different paths. Now, after Hikari leaves, Karen must discover who she is without her opposite, while Hikari must rediscover her own course.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Athletics
tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

title.native: 少女☆歌劇 レヴュー・スタァライト
少女☆歌劇 レヴュースタァライト ロンド・ロンド・ロンド

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TOPPY1218)

**Tomohiro Furukawa** is a director, storyboard artist, and animator best known for [**Shoujo☆Kageki Revue Starlight**](https://anilist.co/anime/98658/ShoujoKageki-Revue-Starlight/). Furukawa's directorial debut was in 2011 on the [*Kunihiko Ikuhara*](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara)-led [**Mawaru Penguindrum**](https://anilist.co/anime/10721/Mawaru-Penguindrum/) where by the end of the project he was co-storyboarding every episode. As a director he absorbed many 'Ikuni school' aesthetic flourishes such as recurring visual motifs with different nuance and stage direction, and infused his own action animator background into his storyboards.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/858004051778166784)

Affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/). Specializes in action scenes.
In March 2010, she graduated from Tokyo Animation College.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/studio_pablo)

Founder and representative director of Studio Pablo.

[Website](http://meganebanchow.com/) | [Blog](http://meganebanchow.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MeganeBanchow)

Also worked on the music for Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko as part of the unit Franz Maxwell I.
Started off as a production manager at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).
